definition: lit. hidden dragon, crouching tiger (idiom)/fig. talented individuals in hiding/concealed talent
to conceal/to hide away/to harbor/to store/to collect

sentences.english: The Old College is the home where tigers and dragons are living.
sentences.chinese: 老年大學是藏龍臥虎的地方。

sentences.english: The college for the seniors is a home for undiscovered talents.
sentences.chinese: 老年大學是藏龍臥虎的地方。

definition: lit. as close as lips and teeth (idiom); closely related/interdependent
magnificent army with thousands of men and horses (idiom); impressive display of manpower/all the King's horses and all the King's men
to become known far and wide (idiom)/famous
to accumulate/to gather/to amass wealth by heavy taxation or other unscrupulous means/(science) convergent
lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
of noble character and unquestionable integrity (idiom)
a falling leaf returns to the roots (idiom); everything has its ancestral home/In old age, an expatriate longs to return home.
"the four classes" of ancient China, i.e. scholars, farmers, artisans, and merchants
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
